documents.document: @MemphisBraves @tamisawyer @JHoustonHill So why didnt you just say your not racist?

@MemphisBraves @tamisawyer @JHoustonHill ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ So now you assume that I assume all white ppl are racist. This thread is actually funny to me. Your actual tweets are just deflection and innuendo. Try not making things up and not speaking for me? Now back to you "Mr. Least Racist".

@MemphisBraves @tamisawyer @JHoustonHill Bruh, you are putting words in my mouth at this point. I never said that at all. I live and operate in a very diverse circle. YOU said you are "least racist". Explain to me how could it mean something that I "wish" when you do not know me and you said it by second tweet?

@MemphisBraves @tamisawyer @JHoustonHill Bruh, I'm still trying to figure out how one is "least racist". Then turn around and clutch pearls. Are you also "least sexist"? Just curious. You said it not me.

@MemphisBraves @tamisawyer @JHoustonHill "least racist". That's really a term ppl use?

@MemphisBraves @tamisawyer @JHoustonHill Ok. I agree with you. They will vote conservative. However, more often than not, a lil' racism goes with that conservatism. Ppl her age are the children of those who supported Jim Crow. Old habits die hard.

The fact that Dems are or will be competitive in statewide races in GA, FL, AL, MS and TX is crazy. Not even thought of a few years ago. 2020 will see Trump having to campaign and spend in states that should have been easy for him. https://t.co/rNivRY678m

@daniecal But if we debating facts and data the numbers do not lie. MS is ranked very low in almost every quality of life index. That is not up for debate. The "why" is certainly debatable.
@daniecal You are arguing with someone that probably agrees with you. Gerrymandering and voter suppression play a huge part in why the states stay red.

@daniecal https://t.co/PVxocO94N6
Ranked 50th by Mental Health America
https://t.co/7uSxfAhjqM
50th in Health care quality rankings by US news
Can go on and on. As for the specific one on depression not sure but these rankings are horrible. Definitely a pattern.

@daniecal I am speaking actual data and facts. Not feelings or going with my gut. The fact is MS is ranked near last in almost all quality of life polls. (education, upward mobility, mental health, health care, etc.) And they continue to vote for republicans over and over.

@daniecal No. A ranking is a ranking. They are ranked 50th by Mental Health America. The rankings are done by criteria and data. McKinnesey and CO. do a state rankings also using publicly available data. They are ranked 50th.

@daniecal According to Mental Health America MS is ranked 50th. Their website has the criteria (providers, access, substance abuse, etc..)
The folks in that state are active participants in their own demise. They are literally voting to ensure a status quo that is leaving them behind.

@VAElite @DuvalSimmonds Facts. But I was once a teenager. And when I was I thought like a teenager and made the mistakes of a teenager. My point is we can teach till we r blue in the face. Kids will make mistakes and need to learn from them. Was not an indictment of anything or anybody.

@VAElite @DuvalSimmonds Playing devils advocate here but alot of FR growing pains in college is natural and normal. You can tell a 17 yr old something a million times but they have to learn for themselves. If every Fr. came to college READY they would be called Sophomores ðŸ˜€
